Reviews.Title: “Discriminatory of vehicles”
Reviews.Author: Saanonymous
Reviews.Content: Don't have a vehicle bigger than a car. Checked in and paid for my room. Went upstairs to my room and turned on the heater, (which rattled horribly), just to have the phone ring. It was the front desk calling to tell me I had to leave the parking lot because I have a truck. There is no posted no truck sign on either entrance. Parked out of the way. When I asked for a refund, I was met with an attitude about I would have to come back when the manager is in the office. So we just went next door to the La Quinta (which gladly accepts any vehicle). I was going to stay here due to a discount that my company gets here, but will never stay here again. I had stayed here many times before but WILL NOT STAY HERE EVEN FOR FREE. Do yourself a favor and stay next door. Much better rooms for $1 more. Bigger bathroom, flatscreen tv, faster internet and friendlier service.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Statement”
Reviews.Author: All Cut U
Reviews.Content: We needed to have somewhere to stay because my son was having surgery at Riley's Hospital early in the morn. The bed was terrible, so where the pillows. Very uncomfortable. We went to plug in our phone charger and two seperate outlits were loose and not working. To top it off I was quoted a rate on $67.15 and they charged my CC $99.00. Had to call them..Then they adjusted it to $78 sumthing. I called again and they said they didnt charge me tax. But where i made the reservation it said that $67.15 was my total costs! Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bacon aroma is your wake-up call”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: This is a good place for an overnight stop near the airport, due to its convenience, free shuttle, and comfortable beds. I couldn’t believe the size of my bed, great quality sheets and huge room for a single. Carpets were old and stained, and the room had few amenities, but at least the free wifi worked great. The toiletries and towels are very nice, and the water pressure in the shower excellent. The hotel is surrounded by many other hotels, but there are few dining options within walking distance—you can walk about 10 minutes to a gas station/convenience store, Waffle House, and a restaurant, but while walking there (on the badly lighted road) I got propositioned by a creepy man in a car, so I don’t really recommend it. The breakfast selection looked excellent—lots of fruit, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and cereal choices, for healthy options. The entire lobby smells strongly of bacon. In fact it wafted right up to the third floor, which I guess was enough to wake me up even though the wake-up call I requested did not happen at 5:30 a.m. The shuttle did leave on time. Aside from the missed wake-up call, I was satisfied with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night's stay”
Reviews.Author: JustaHoosier
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay in Indy for one or two nights, the Ramada Inn-Airport is a good option. Although some of the public areas, especially the elevator, could use a good cleaning/sprucing up, the room itself was fine. Despite the proximity to I-465, everything was quiet. Breakfast was good too--waffles are available. Nothing fancy here, mind you, but the price was right (a special rate), the hotel was very convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: devils22db
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel that offerred one of the best airport shuttles I've experienced, being on-call 24 hrs. and it was prompt and friendly with a large, clean van. Room was quite large, with plenty of work-space and elbow-room. Offered breakfast on the go if needed. Front desk was responsive to my needs and worked very professionally and courteous. If flying into Indy for business or quick stay-over, this is a good location.

Reviews.Title: “older property but nicely kept”
Reviews.Author: bgould1001
Reviews.Content: Traveling through and got a good rate. Even with the road construction we found it fairly easily. Easy parking and the front desk staff were pleasant. Spacious lobby and breakfast area. Breakfast was above average with lots of variety. Room was very spacious, very clean and very comfortable. Busy hotel with lots of business travelers but all were well behaved and any smokers were smoking outside. We plan on using this hotel if we park and fly out of Indy.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ackart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night getting in late for a flight. They had 24 hour transportation but the shuttle.couldn't get me so. Had to call a taxi and they paid. The room was recently updated. Bed was lumpy as were the pillows, breakfast was bad since they had lukewarm coffee. The towels were thin. Front desk was helpful. In room coffee was hot I brewed myself. The area was near the old airport and seemed like a safe area. Free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: morrishj
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on our way from Canada to Oklahoma. Our room was spacious, the bed comfortable and we had free WiFi and free breakfast. We asked if we could have a refrigerator in our room since we had coolers of perishable items and they found one and brought it to us! Our room was very clean and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “TRUCK DRIVERS”
Reviews.Author: Magazinedude
Reviews.Content: Lots of smokers and Truck Drivers talking about just getting out of Jail etc. Deodorant not used here much. Thats the greeting upon arrival right out front. The rooms are spacious but musty and smelly. Very average Ramada!! I would suggest to management to make a area out back for the Truck Drivers to hang out and talk nasty!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: DitzyDeltaDawn
Reviews.Content: I was in town for my high school reunion last summer and was searching for a place within my budget for my trip. I managed to find a deal for this hotel, which I was really excited about. The staff was friendly enough. Maid service did what they could for making the room comfortable. The room itself was not what I expected. The hotel could use some updating. The cooling system was not working well. That may have been more to do with the arrangement of having the desk directly beside the air unit so it was blowing directly at the desk as opposed to into the open room. I did try moving the desk a bit but it still did not completely cool properly. The room was very musty. I don't know if it was something in the room or the location of the room by the stairwell that was the issue. If you can get a deal on this hotel and you're not planning on spending a lot of time in your room, then this may be a good setup for you.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience, to say the least.”
Reviews.Author: familyfun4the5js
Reviews.Content: I've never experienced such an all around terrible hotel experience; even when I have had the unfortunate occassion of staying at a low budget hotel/motel. 1. Only one of the two rooms reserved for my party were available. 2. (Two) double beds rooms were reserved, only one king bed w/sofa sleeper available. 3. After checking in and settling into king room, we had to be moved because of the wet carpet due to bad plumbing. 4. The sofa sleeper in the new room had broken legs. 5. The television did not work. 6. Ceiling tile were molded and missing. 7. 3 guests were registered in room, housekeeping would only leave towels for two. If the cliche "you get what you pay for" is true, I'd say we need a refund! Horrible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: pam_from_indiana
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff. Great stay. Couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 1greenriver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on January 6, 2011, We got up on the 7 and they took us all to the airport even though only one of us was flying and then they came back and pick up the ones that wasnt. Becky at the front desk so nice and the gentleman (Rodney) that shuttled us back from the airport was super nice. We couldnt have asked for a better stay. I would diffently stay there again. Thanks so much for a great stay Charlene

Reviews.Title: “The Most Fantastic Hotel in INDY!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thedon95648
Reviews.Content: I'm a National Account Executive, and I travel a lot for work. I have stayed at the Ramada 4 consecutive times during my travels. The staff are wonderful, and the continental breakfast is the best I have ever had, and I must say I have stayed at a lot of hotels, and the food is normally nasty. It's a very clean hotel and the beds are very comfortable. This is the only hotel I will ever stay at when I travel to Indianapolis, IN. I reccomend that the person reading my review do the same. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates and friendly staff with a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Montana_Tom49
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently, the staff could not be nicer, The rooms are very spacious and many have micro wave ovens and refridgerators. The airport shuttle is highly reliable.

Reviews.Title: “This is a clean, inviting, resonably priced hotel with a welcoming friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: sailinbob
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Oct 10 through November. I was at another hotel ( I'll call it a hotel that I didn't want to extend my stay more than one night) and moved over to this location. The staff is warm and friendly. The room was clean and well appointed. The other hotel I had to buy my own hair products and soap. I am so happy I didn't have to stay another night at the extendo-stay place. The bed here at the Ramada provided a perfect place to rest after a long day at work. I will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Way outdated and smelly!!”
Reviews.Author: Vikyrodri_07
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in we hated it! Smelled horrible! We got a king suit and it was not worth what we paid for it!! Everything about the room was old and disgusting!! I won't ever stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “perfectly service-able”
Reviews.Author: alicia44
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay - room large, clean, great amenities, comfortable and did I mention clean? And a surprisingly good breakfast with fresh waffles and hard boiled eggs. Can't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Rooms - Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jana2408
Reviews.Content: Please note this is the first time I have written a bad review. Rooms were filthy, didn't even stay at hotel and had to find a new one. Our credit card was charged full amount even though we didn't stay. The manager Barbara has been unhelpful and has ignored dozens of e-mails and phone calls. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Stinks”
Reviews.Author: Frank-O-XO
Reviews.Content: After several (4) calls to retrieve something left in the room I never received a return call. I left a detailed message with head of house keeping. I spoke with some one in management, Barbara I think and detailed my issue, she has not called back and it has been a week.

Reviews.Title: “This is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tartanangel1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice now this time for an extended 5 night stay due to the motogp at the Speedway. The rooms are massive, bed a great big kingsize, comfortable, clean, has all the amenities you need. The reception staff are extremely helpful and all areas of the hotel are spotless. Yes it might be a little older but I feel its bright and friendly. The Manager though was a bit grumpy but her other staff made up for it. The breakfast isn't deluxe but its a good start to the day. All in all I think this hotel is good value for money its quiet and in a handy location. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing, pick another hotel if you nead to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: RC-indy
Reviews.Content: We picked this property because of the enticing rate and the Ramada name but were very disappointed. Booked and was given a king room only to find it was not cleaned after the prior guests. The front desk clerk did not seem surprised and gave us a 2 bed room instead. The second room was not much better. The blankets were stained and the bathroom was dirty. We were given replacement blankets but were told there were no more rooms available at the rate we had booked on line. We checked out the next morning and found a much better hotel to stay at within minutes away at near the same price.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but slight disappointment”
Reviews.Author: PaulH82
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very convenient, close to the airport. not much noise from either the truck depot behind it or indeed the airport. the room was a typical 2 bed room with bath/shower layout as in 100s of other hotels. the wifi worked fine but the tv was a little past it's best. no self-laundry tho, a bit of a disappointment and an inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: hale29
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling with 2 small childern we get to the hotel late at night to get up in the morning to go to the Indianapolis zoo. After we get in the hotel room, we noticed we have no blankets or pillows for the pull out bed (for the kids) and 2 towels and 1 washcloth. We called down to the desk and told us that we needed to make due because their washer had been broke for 2 days and to use the decorative pillows on the couch for the kids' pillows (you could tell they had never been washed) . When we checked out the lady asked how our visit was and we told her and she didn't even offer to take any money off. It was horrible! I don't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “It's all in the details...”
Reviews.Author: flutepilot
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this property, and things have changed a bit. Last year, I loved the place and gave it five stars. This time, on two stops - both ways on our Christmas trip to Tennessee - things were not quite as good. First, the good. The counter staff is as friendly and helpful as ever. The breakfast bar has added do-it-yourself waffles to an already good breakfast bar. There is still coffee available in the breakfast bar area 24 hours a day. Now the not so good. On our trip down, I had to go to the desk for both facial and toilet tissue. This is a maid problem and should never happen. On our trip back, we discovered two lamps not working, with bulbs totally missing. I got light bulbs and one of the two still did not work. This is absurd. In addition, there was mold around the tub on the trip back. None of these things occured on our trip last year. I know that this property lost its contract with one of the airlines serving Indianapolis for overnighting their aircrews. Could these types of problems be the reason? As I said in my title, it's all in the details which aren't being watched very closely now, sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good price”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: My business has booked me to stay here twice at $69/night. The hotel is clean and is a good option if you are looking for a place by the airport. The free breakfast includes cereal, some pastries that are not that good, waffles, yogurt, either sausage or bacon and egg patties. It's not too bad. I did not mind staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for early morning flight out of IND!”
Reviews.Author: GoOnVacation
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel on Wednesday November 5, 2008. We had a 6:38am flight from Indianapolis airport on November 6. We arrived after 9pm on Nov 5 and the desk clerk had our room ready when we arrived. He scheduled our hotel shuttle ride to the airport for the next morning and processed our parking fee for our car. This hotel lets you park your car there for $5/day and offers a shuttle ride to the airport with pick-up at the airport after your flight is complete. I received a business card with the phone number to call when we arrived back in Indianapolis. We called them when we got to baggage claim and the van was pulling up as we were walking out of the terminal. The morning shuttle to the airport was waiting on US! We left on schedule at the time we requested. Great job! The hotel was very bright and clean and the rooms were comfortable and quiet. I wish we could have spent more time there! The hotel honored all of my requests I entered on their website during the booking of the room. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “They do not honor "lowest rate guarantee"”
Reviews.Author: Sommerset
Reviews.Content: I want to be say right away, I did not stay at this hotel. I intended to. I found a rate cheaper on a different booking site than what was posted on their own site and called to ask them about their "low rate guarantee". They were very rude and did everything possible to make sure I would not get a night free as "guaranteed" on their website. They "encouraged" me to cancel my reservation which I naturally did. We are in town on business and need hotel by the airport so we will stay at the Country Inn instead. By the way, the lower rate was still available as of yesterday. Shame on Ramada and we will never stay with any Ramada again, either on business or holiday travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: The Ramada was clean and comfortable, and very reasonably priced. The included breakfast was much better than the standard continental breakfast at similar hotels. Service was courteous and helpful. I would certainly return to this hotel if the occasion arose.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: RaveDJ
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels from budget to 5-star, including lots of Hampton Inns. This one is no exception to the general rule for the group - it is excellent value for money and would be my choice should I stay in the area again. I'm sure this must have been converted from a Hilton Hotel, at some point, as have many others in the chain. As several reviewers have said, it offers excellent service, massive rooms and was remarkably quiet. And it's only 3 minutes from the airport! Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March, 2006 before an early morning flight. The rooms were clean, large, and quiet (important when you have an early morning flight). I had the breakfast to go bag which was nice to take along to eat on the plane (cereal bar, muffin, water, and apple). The only negative was the mattress was soft and the fitted sheet was too small so it came undone. I guess another negative is that it was expensive because of the Final Four. I paid $177 (including taxes) per night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seacruiser1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hampton Inn Airport for a one night prior to a morning flight and I can say we received on oversize room that was quiet and comfortable and the service was outstanding. We booked this room through Priceline. It was ranked as a 2 star and deserves a much higher rating. There was a variety of of breakfast selections and they even had a brown bag breakfast for the flight! The staff was attentive and courteous printing out directions to a nice local restaurant and even our Southwest boarding passes! Shuttle service to the airport was prompt both ways and we parked our vehicle for a nominal fee.

Reviews.Title: “Low cost hotel with high class service”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed by my stay at the Indianapolis Airport Hampton Inn. I stayed here one night on a business trip. The staff here were friendly and had a service-oriented attitude that staff at full service hotels often lack. At check-in. the clerk asked me if I needed directions anywhere, wanted a restaurant recommendation, and if I needed a wake-up call. The room I stayed in was huge: I think I may have been given an upgrade over the room that I reserved. It had a new king size bed, lots of space (I was able to do my exercises without trying to squeeze into narrow spaces in the room), and wonderful bathroom, and a comfortable layout. The room was extremely quiet: I did not hear any traffic or plane noise at all. The shuttle service was on-demand and fast. They took me to a restaurant for dinner at request, and were back to get me in less than five minutes when I was done. At check-out, they were able to provide me with a box, tape, etc. so I was able to pack up a box to be mailed back to my office, and even offered to fed ex it for me from the hotel and put the charge on my room bill. The breakfast was typical Hampton Inn which is to say fine. The hallways could use some refurbishing; that's about the only negative thing that comes to mind. I would definately stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Airport Indianapolis
HotelInfo.Address: 5601 Fortune Circle West, Indianapolis, IN 46241 (Formerly Hampton Inn)
